# The Basic Block Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A basic block represents a single entry single exit section of code. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

A basic block represents a single entry single exit section of code.

Basic blocks contain a list of instructions which form the body of the block.

Basic blocks belong to functions. They have the type of label.

Basic blocks are themselves values. However, the C API models them as <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a>.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock">llvm::BasicBlock</a>
</SectionUser>

### LLVMDeleteBasicBlock() {#ga174c942f924efd2dac593073e79f694c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMDeleteBasicBlock (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> BB)</>}>
Remove a basic block from a function and delete it.

This deletes the basic block from its containing function and deletes the basic block itself.

### LLVMGetBasicBlocks() {#ga699b8756d996785085a48a703932add3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void LLVMGetBasicBlocks (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Fn, <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> &#42; BasicBlocks)</>}>
Obtain all of the basic blocks in a function.

This operates on a function value. The BasicBlocks parameter is a pointer to a pre-allocated array of <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> of at least <a href="#ga767498a2a7d01498ce302e8a66da2b61">LLVMCountBasicBlocks()</a> in length. This array is populated with <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> instances.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l03391">3391</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l02801">2801</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetBasicBlockTerminator() {#ga754e45f69f4b784b658d9e379943f354}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMValueRef LLVMGetBasicBlockTerminator (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#gab57bd16a0147aad5c492a0d97e0df8a9">LLVMBasicBlockRef</a> BB)</>}>
Obtain the terminator instruction for a basic block.

If the basic block does not have a terminator (it is not well-formed if it doesn&#39;t), then NULL is returned.

The returned <a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> corresponds to an <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">llvm::Instruction</a>.


<SectionUser title="See Also">
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/basicblock/#aaf87930bfa1c4483b0d94ce7b8622a91">llvm::BasicBlock::getTerminator()</a>
</SectionUser>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h/#l03374">3374</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm-c/core-h">Core.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp/#l02793">2793</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/core-cpp">Core.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### LLVMGetFirstBasicBlock() {#ga27930a1f6ef942a6d6b70a880af24f14}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>LLVMBasicBlockRef LLVMGetFirstBasicBlock (<a href="/docs/api/groups/llvmcsupporttypes/#ga113ce952344691b8304a43a314f8be17">LLVMValueRef</a> Fn)</>}>
Obtain the first basic block in a function.

The returned basic block can be used as an iterator. You will likely eventually call into <a href="#ga07967d9c5eb0aa3dd8c2f0a0068ae3aa">LLVMGetNextBasicBlock()</a> with it.

</SectionUser>

This deletes the basic block from its containing function but keep the basic block alive.
